title: Shap Values from kernel Explainer Change drastically with background example set change.
body:
Hi,
hope you are doing well.

I am using kernel explainer to find shap values for 60 features (some are onehot encoded) with a tensorflow neural network model prediction. my original training data contains around 240000 rows of data. 
I am using around 500 background examples and the explainer is not that fast in calculating the results (with more background examples it takes too long) . 
so I have following two issues with my results:
1: i choose 500 background examples randomly and if i choose another set of 500 background examples my shap values seem to be very different for some features! how can i make sure i get stable results and if the results are valid.
2: there are many features that have 0 as the shap value. does that mean number of backgrounds are not enough? what should i do to avoid it without taking more background examples? (it takes too long with 500 already).

thank you in advance for your help. 
@slundberg
